trial_identification.studytitle: Treatment of Recently Acquired Hepatitis C With the 3D Regimen or G/P
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An Open Label, Multicentre, International Pilot Study of Paritaprevir/Ritonavir, Ombitasvir, Dasabuvir With or Without Ribavirin or Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir for People With Recently Acquired Hepatitis C Virus Infection With or Without HIV Co-infection.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir Treatment: drugs - Dasabuvir Treatment: drugs - Ribavirin Treatment: drugs - Glecaprevir/pibrentasvir
Experimental: Cohort 1 - Paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir (75mg/50mg/12.5mg) and dasabuvir (250mg) with or without ribavirin (1000-1200mg) daily taken orally for 8 weeks.
Experimental: Cohort 2 - Three tablets of glecaprevir/pibrentasvir (100mg/40mg) daily taken orally for 6 weeks
Experimental: Cohort 3 - Three tablets of glecaprevir/pibrentasvir (100mg/40mg) daily taken orally for 4 weeks
Treatment: drugs: Paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir
Treatment: drugs: Dasabuvir
Treatment: drugs: Ribavirin
Treatment: drugs: Glecaprevir/pibrentasvir

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of treated subjects (intention-to-treat (ITT) population) demonstrating undetectable hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA at 12 weeks following treatment (SVR 12).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The proportion of treated subjects overall with ETR, SVR4 and SVR24 defined as undetectable HCV RNA at end of therapy, 4 weeks and 24 weeks post therapy, respectively.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: End of treatment- week 6 or week 8 depending on the study arm; 4 weeks post treatment; 24 weeks post treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Comparison of ETR, SVR4, SVR12 and SVR24 between those receiving 8 weeks treatment and those receiving 6 weeks treatment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: End of treatment- week 6 or week 8 depending on the study arm; 4 weeks post treatment; 12 weeks post treatment; 24 weeks post treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Comparison of adherence between those receiving 8 weeks treatment and those receiving 6 weeks treatment
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline to week 6 or week 8 treatment duration
Baseline through to 6 or 8 weeks depending on the study arm

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion with adverse events (including serious adverse events)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline to week 6 or week 8 treatment duration

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in laboratory parameters, including liver function tests (ALT, AST) and haematological indices (haemoglobin, neutrophil count, platelet count)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline to week 6 or week 8 treatment duration
Baseline through to 6 or 8 weeks depending on the study arm

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in sexual and injecting drug use behaviour at SVR 12 and end of follow up
Serum cytokine and ISG expression at baseline and week 4

ethicsAndSummary.summary: An open label, multicentre, international pilot study of paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, dasabuvir with or without ribavirin or glecaprevir/pibrentasvir for people with recently acquired hepatitis C virus infection with or without HIV co-infection.
